title: Inter-Agent Communication Protocols
body_html:
Inter-Agent Communication Protocols

Communication Types

1. Synchronous Communication

  • Direct agent-to-agent messaging
  • Wait for response pattern
  • Used for critical decision-making

2. Asynchronous Communication

  • Message queuing system
  • Event-driven updates
  • Non-blocking operations

Message Structure

Standard Message Format

{
    "sender_id": "agent-uuid",
    "recipient_id": "agent-uuid",
    "message_type": "task|update|query",
    "content": {
        "type": "specific_message_type",
        "payload": {},
        "timestamp": "ISO-8601"
    },
    "priority": "normal|high|urgent"
}

Communication Patterns

1. Broadcast Messages

  • System-wide announcements
  • Status updates
  • Global state changes

2. Direct Messages

  • Task assignments
  • Information requests
  • Status updates

3. Event Notifications

  • Task completion
  • Error alerts
  • State changes

Memory Integration

1. Shared Memory Access

  • Core memory updates
  • Archival memory queries
  • Synchronized state management

2. Memory Consistency

  • Update protocols
  • Conflict resolution
  • Version control

Error Handling

1. Message Delivery

  • Retry mechanisms
  • Timeout handling
  • Failure notifications

2. State Recovery

  • Consistency checks
  • Rollback procedures
  • State synchronization

Security Considerations

1. Message Validation

  • Sender verification
  • Content integrity
  • Access control

2. Data Protection

  • Sensitive information handling
  • Secure transmission
  • Privacy preservation

Implementation Guidelines

1. Message Processing

def process_message(message):
    validate_message(message)
    route_to_handler(message)
    update_state(message)
    send_acknowledgment()

2. Error Recovery

def handle_error(error):
    log_error(error)
    notify_sender(error)
    attempt_recovery()
    update_system_state()

Best Practices

  1. Always validate message format
  2. Implement proper error handling
  3. Maintain message logs
  4. Monitor system health
  5. Regular state synchronization
